title: Slope Calculator
seoTitle: Slope Calculator - What Is the Slope Between Two Points?

en.introduction: Calculate the slope (gradient) between two points instantly with our comprehensive slope calculator. Find the slope, line equation, distance between points, midpoint, and angle of inclination for any two coordinate pairs.
benefits: Instant slope calculation from two points (x₁, y₁) and (x₂, y₂)
Display line equation in slope-intercept form (y = mx + b)
Calculate distance between the two points
Find midpoint coordinates automatically
Calculate angle of inclination in degrees
Handle vertical lines (undefined slope) and horizontal lines (zero slope)
Visual representation of the slope and line
Step-by-step explanation of calculations
steps: Enter the coordinates of the first point (x₁, y₁)
Enter the coordinates of the second point (x₂, y₂)
Click Calculate to see all results
View the slope value, line equation, distance, midpoint, and angle
Observe the visual graph showing the line and points
en.inputsExplained: The calculator requires two points in a coordinate plane. Each point consists of an x-coordinate (horizontal position) and a y-coordinate (vertical position). You can enter positive or negative numbers, including decimals.
en.formulaExplanation: Slope (m) = (y₂ - y₁) / (x₂ - x₁). This represents the change in y divided by the change in x, also known as 'rise over run'. The line equation is y = mx + b, where b is the y-intercept. Distance = √[(x₂-x₁)² + (y₂-y₁)²]. Midpoint = ((x₁+x₂)/2, (y₁+y₂)/2). Angle = arctan(m) converted to degrees.
examples: Points (0, 0) and (4, 4): Slope = 1 (45° angle, y = x)
Points (1, 5) and (1, 8): Undefined slope (vertical line, x = 1)
en.resultsExplanation: Results include: Slope (m) - the steepness of the line; Line equation in y = mx + b form; Distance - the length between the two points; Midpoint - the center point between the two coordinates; Angle - the angle of inclination from the positive x-axis in degrees (0° to 180°).
en.whoItsFor: This calculator is perfect for students learning coordinate geometry, engineers working with linear relationships, architects designing slopes, surveyors calculating terrain gradients, and anyone needing to analyze linear relationships between two points.
en.disclaimer: This calculator provides accurate mathematical calculations. For vertical lines (x₁ = x₂), the slope is undefined. Results are rounded to appropriate decimal places for display purposes. Always verify critical calculations independently.

faqs.question: What is slope in mathematics?
faqs.answer: Slope is a measure of the steepness of a line. It represents how much the y-value changes for each unit change in x. A positive slope means the line rises from left to right, while a negative slope means it falls.

faqs.question: What does undefined slope mean?
faqs.answer: An undefined slope occurs when you have a vertical line (where x₁ = x₂). Since you're dividing by zero (x₂ - x₁ = 0), the slope cannot be calculated. The line equation is simply x = constant.

faqs.question: What is the difference between slope and gradient?
faqs.answer: Slope and gradient are the same thing - they both measure the steepness of a line. 'Slope' is more commonly used in the US, while 'gradient' is often used in other English-speaking countries.

faqs.question: How do I interpret the slope value?
faqs.answer: A slope of 1 means a 45° line (rise = run). Slope > 1 is steeper than 45°. Slope between 0 and 1 is less steep. Slope = 0 is horizontal. Negative slopes indicate lines falling from left to right.

faqs.question: Can slope be negative?
faqs.answer: Yes! A negative slope means the line goes downward from left to right. For example, if you go from point (0, 5) to (5, 0), the slope is -1, indicating the line decreases by 1 unit vertically for each unit it moves horizontally.

faqs.question: ¿Qué es la pendiente en matemáticas?
faqs.answer: La pendiente es una medida de la inclinación de una recta. Representa cuánto cambia el valor y por cada unidad de cambio en x. Una pendiente positiva significa que la recta sube de izquierda a derecha, mientras que una pendiente negativa significa que baja.

faqs.question: ¿Qué significa pendiente indefinida?
faqs.answer: Una pendiente indefinida ocurre cuando tienes una línea vertical (donde x₁ = x₂). Como estás dividiendo por cero (x₂ - x₁ = 0), la pendiente no se puede calcular. La ecuación de la recta es simplemente x = constante.

faqs.question: ¿Cuál es la diferencia entre pendiente y gradiente?
faqs.answer: Pendiente y gradiente son lo mismo - ambos miden la inclinación de una recta. 'Pendiente' es más común en español, mientras que 'gradiente' también se usa en contextos técnicos.

faqs.question: ¿Cómo interpreto el valor de la pendiente?
faqs.answer: Una pendiente de 1 significa una línea de 45° (elevación = recorrido). Pendiente > 1 es más inclinada que 45°. Pendiente entre 0 y 1 es menos inclinada. Pendiente = 0 es horizontal. Las pendientes negativas indican líneas que bajan de izquierda a derecha.

faqs.question: ¿Puede la pendiente ser negativa?
faqs.answer: ¡Sí! Una pendiente negativa significa que la línea va hacia abajo de izquierda a derecha. Por ejemplo, si vas del punto (0, 5) al (5, 0), la pendiente es -1, indicando que la línea disminuye 1 unidad verticalmente por cada unidad que se mueve horizontalmente.

faqs.question: O que é inclinação em matemática?
faqs.answer: Inclinação é uma medida da inclinação de uma reta. Representa quanto o valor y muda para cada unidade de mudança em x. Uma inclinação positiva significa que a reta sobe da esquerda para a direita, enquanto uma inclinação negativa significa que desce.

faqs.question: O que significa inclinação indefinida?
faqs.answer: Uma inclinação indefinida ocorre quando você tem uma linha vertical (onde x₁ = x₂). Como você está dividindo por zero (x₂ - x₁ = 0), a inclinação não pode ser calculada. A equação da reta é simplesmente x = constante.

faqs.question: Qual é a diferença entre inclinação e gradiente?
faqs.answer: Inclinação e gradiente são a mesma coisa - ambos medem a inclinação de uma reta. Os termos são usados de forma intercambiável em matemática.

faqs.question: Como interpreto o valor da inclinação?
faqs.answer: Uma inclinação de 1 significa uma linha de 45° (subida = percurso). Inclinação > 1 é mais íngreme que 45°. Inclinação entre 0 e 1 é menos íngreme. Inclinação = 0 é horizontal. Inclinações negativas indicam linhas que descem da esquerda para a direita.

faqs.question: A inclinação pode ser negativa?
faqs.answer: Sim! Uma inclinação negativa significa que a linha vai para baixo da esquerda para a direita. Por exemplo, se você vai do ponto (0, 5) para (5, 0), a inclinação é -1, indicando que a linha diminui 1 unidade verticalmente para cada unidade que se move horizontalmente.

faqs.question: Qu'est-ce que la pente en mathématiques?
faqs.answer: La pente est une mesure de l'inclinaison d'une ligne. Elle représente combien la valeur y change pour chaque unité de changement en x. Une pente positive signifie que la ligne monte de gauche à droite, tandis qu'une pente négative signifie qu'elle descend.

faqs.question: Que signifie pente indéfinie?
faqs.answer: Une pente indéfinie se produit lorsque vous avez une ligne verticale (où x₁ = x₂). Comme vous divisez par zéro (x₂ - x₁ = 0), la pente ne peut pas être calculée. L'équation de la ligne est simplement x = constante.

faqs.question: Quelle est la différence entre pente et gradient?
faqs.answer: Pente et gradient sont la même chose - ils mesurent tous deux l'inclinaison d'une ligne. Les termes sont utilisés de manière interchangeable en mathématiques.

faqs.question: Comment interpréter la valeur de la pente?
faqs.answer: Une pente de 1 signifie une ligne de 45° (montée = course). Pente > 1 est plus raide que 45°. Pente entre 0 et 1 est moins raide. Pente = 0 est horizontal. Les pentes négatives indiquent des lignes qui descendent de gauche à droite.

faqs.question: La pente peut-elle être négative?
faqs.answer: Oui! Une pente négative signifie que la ligne descend de gauche à droite. Par exemple, si vous allez du point (0, 5) au (5, 0), la pente est -1, indiquant que la ligne diminue de 1 unité verticalement pour chaque unité qu'elle se déplace horizontalement.

de.introduction: Berechnen Sie die Steigung (Gradient) zwischen zwei Punkten sofort mit unserem umfassenden Steigungsrechner. Finden Sie Steigung, Geradengleichung, Abstand zwischen Punkten, Mittelpunkt und Neigungswinkel für beliebige Koordinatenpaare.
de.formulaExplanation: Steigung (m) = (y₂ - y₁) / (x₂ - x₁). Dies stellt die Änderung in y geteilt durch die Änderung in x dar, auch bekannt als 'Steigung über Lauf'. Die Geradengleichung ist y = mx + b, wobei b der y-Achsenabschnitt ist.

faqs.question: Was ist Steigung in der Mathematik?
faqs.answer: Steigung ist ein Maß für die Steilheit einer Linie. Sie zeigt, wie stark sich der y-Wert für jede Einheitsänderung in x ändert. Eine positive Steigung bedeutet, dass die Linie von links nach rechts ansteigt, während eine negative Steigung bedeutet, dass sie fällt.

faqs.question: Was bedeutet undefinierte Steigung?
faqs.answer: Eine undefinierte Steigung tritt auf, wenn Sie eine vertikale Linie haben (wobei x₁ = x₂). Da Sie durch Null teilen (x₂ - x₁ = 0), kann die Steigung nicht berechnet werden. Die Geradengleichung ist einfach x = konstant.

faqs.question: Kann die Steigung negativ sein?
faqs.answer: Ja! Eine negative Steigung bedeutet, dass die Linie von links nach rechts abwärts geht. Zum Beispiel, wenn Sie von Punkt (0, 5) zu (5, 0) gehen, ist die Steigung -1, was anzeigt, dass die Linie um 1 Einheit vertikal für jede horizontale Einheit abnimmt.

nl.introduction: Bereken de helling (gradiënt) tussen twee punten direct met onze uitgebreide hellingrekenmachine. Vind helling, lijnvergelijking, afstand tussen punten, middelpunt en hellingshoek voor elk paar coördinaten.
nl.formulaExplanation: Helling (m) = (y₂ - y₁) / (x₂ - x₁). Dit vertegenwoordigt de verandering in y gedeeld door de verandering in x, ook bekend als 'stijging over loop'. De lijnvergelijking is y = mx + b, waarbij b het snijpunt met de y-as is.

faqs.question: Wat is helling in de wiskunde?
faqs.answer: Helling is een maat voor de steilheid van een lijn. Het toont hoeveel de y-waarde verandert voor elke eenheidsverandering in x. Een positieve helling betekent dat de lijn stijgt van links naar rechts, terwijl een negatieve helling betekent dat deze daalt.

faqs.question: Wat betekent ongedefinieerde helling?
faqs.answer: Een ongedefinieerde helling treedt op wanneer u een verticale lijn heeft (waarbij x₁ = x₂). Omdat u door nul deelt (x₂ - x₁ = 0), kan de helling niet worden berekend. De lijnvergelijking is eenvoudig x = constante.

faqs.question: Kan de helling negatief zijn?
faqs.answer: Ja! Een negatieve helling betekent dat de lijn van links naar rechts naar beneden gaat. Bijvoorbeeld, als u van punt (0, 5) naar (5, 0) gaat, is de helling -1, wat aangeeft dat de lijn met 1 eenheid verticaal daalt voor elke horizontale eenheid.
